Parameters

save_playlist(self, tracks_list, name=None)

save playlist in your spotify profile user_id most be specified in object

Parameters

  • name (string, optional) – name of playlist, else (very) random name will be created. Defaults to None.

Raises

rank_artists(self)

Creates a dict with the ranking of the artists. and related artist (more suitable for multiple listeners)

Returns

Counter dict with artist_id as key and value is the count/ranking of the artist

Return type

create_playlist(self, n_songs=25, genre=None, n_artists=25, save=False, name=None)

creates a random playlist based in your top artists or selected genre

Parameters

  • n_songs (int, optional) – number of songs in the playlist. Defaults to 25.

  • genre (_type_, optional) – _description_. Defaults to None.

  • n_artists (int, optional) – number of top artists chosen. Defaults to 25.

  • save (bool, optional) – whether playlist should be saved in account. user_id must be specified in the object. Defaults to False.

  • name (_type_, optional) – name of playlist. if not specified (very) random

  • None. (name is created. Defaults to) –

Returns

list of track ids if not saved as playlist

Return type

list

playlist_based_on_single_song(self, songID=None, save_playlist=False)
class mkply.MultiListener(list_of_listeners, spotify_account)
rank_artists(self)

Creates a dict with the ranking of the artists. Highest ranked artist should be the most popular among listeners. This is based on the top aritist of the Listener. If Listener like the same artist the count will be increased by 2, if Listener likes an artist related artist the count will be increased by 1. Weakness: Is very depending on the distrubition of artists of listeners. Ranking can be created in favour of one Listener (if Listener is listing heavily one genre and to artist related artists)

Returns

Counter dict with artist_id as key and value is the count/ranking of the artist

Return type

_type_

create_playlist(self, n_songs=25, genre=None, n_artists=25, save=False, name=None)

creates a random playlist based in your top artists (atm) or selected genre

Parameters

  • n_songs (int, optional) – number of songs in the playlist. Defaults to 25.

  • genre (_type_, optional) – _description_. Defaults to None.

  • n_artists (int, optional) – number of top artists chosen. Defaults to 25.

  • save (bool, optional) – whether playlist should be saved in account. user_id must be specified in the object. Defaults to False.

  • name (_type_, optional) – name of playlist. if not specified (very) random

  • None. (name is created. Defaults to) –

Returns

_description_

Return type
